bounds

public T bounds(double northLat,
                double eastLon,
                double southLat,
                double westLon)
Very shorthand method for setting bounding on the MapView.

Parameters:
northLat - top bound
eastLon - right bound
southLat - bottom bound
westLon - left bound
Returns:
self
See Also:
#setOutOfBoundsBounding(BoundingBox)} {@link #setOutOfBoundsAutoBounding(boolean, boolean)} {@link BoundingBox}

bounds - a predefined bounding box.

self

setOutOfBoundsAutoBounding

public T setOutOfBoundsAutoBounding(boolean autoBound,
                                    boolean snap)
Parameters:
autoBound - should auto bind, requires setOutOfBoundsBounding(OutOfBoundsOverlay.BoundingBox) to be set to work.
snap - if true the view will snap back to the bound box, false will animate
Returns:

                                     OutOfBoundsCallbacks mListener)
Register and set the bounding box

Parameters:
boundingBox -
mListener -
Returns:

registerOutOfBoundsListener

public T registerOutOfBoundsListener(OutOfBoundsCallbacks mListener)
Register a OutOfBounds listener, remember you need to set the bounding box, so if you haven't called registerOutOfBoundsListener(OutOfBoundsOverlay.BoundingBox, OutOfBoundsCallbacks) or setOutOfBoundsBounding(OutOfBoundsOverlay.BoundingBox) nothing will happen.

Parameters:
mListener -
Returns:

drawOutOfBoundsBox

public T drawOutOfBoundsBox(boolean draw)
This will draw your currently set bounding box on the OutOfBoundsOverlay. It will appear as a red box for the area you want to bound.

Parameters:
draw - true to draw it, false will hide it.
Returns:
